frameDefinitions: A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
This frame contains items which, when manipulated, alter the function of some device, internal or external.
This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered.
An Entity has a Temperature characterized by the target.
frameExamples: She was in <t>control</t> of the empire within two days.
This <t>button</t> makes the radio turn on.
(1) They took <t>revenge</t> for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners.
The pan is already too <t>hot</t> to touch.
listRoleDefinitions: A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> or an <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>.
A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, a <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or a <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics control a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
The <fex name='deg'>Degree</fex> to which the Controlling element affects the Dependent element.
The <fex name='tim'>Time</fex> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>. This is often an incorporated FE.
The <fen>Avenger</fen> exacts revenge from the <fen>Offender</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>.
The <fen>Offender</fen> has committed the earlier <fen>Injury</fen> for which the <fen>Avenger</fen> seeks revenge.
The <fen>Avenger</fen> carries out a <fen>Punishment</fen> in order to exact revenge on the <fen>Offender</fen>.

The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action committed by the <fen>Offender</fen> against the <fen>Injured_Party</fen>. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary.

This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the <fen>Injury</fen> at the hands of the <fen>Offender</fen>. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the <fen>Injury</fen>. These also constitute instances of  <fen>Injured_party</fen>
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the revenge occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the revenge occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Degree</fen> for the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.
Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.
Jo had the affair as a kind of revenge <fex>against Pat</fex>.
The team took revenge <fex>with a resounding victory</fex>.
The team sought revenge <fex>for their 4-1 defeat last month</fex>.
The skillet had a temperature <fex>of 230 F</fex>
